name: vscode-double-line-numbers
description: Display both absolute and relative line numbers.

vscode-double-line-numbers.enableLineHig.markdownDescription: Enable dynamic line highlighting with embedded line numbers in the background

vscode-double-line-numbers.highlight.sho.markdownDescription: Show the line number in the background pattern

vscode-double-line-numbers.font.color.markdownDescription: Font color of left line numbers. Examples: `red`, `#858585`, `rgb(0,0,255)`. [More info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value)

vscode-double-line-numbers.font.weight.markdownDescription: Font boldness of left line numbers. Examples: `normal`, `bold`, `600`. [More info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-weight)

vscode-double-line-numbers.font.family.markdownDescription: Font family of left line numbers. Examples: `Menlo`, `Monaco`, `Courier New`, `monospace`. [More info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-family)

vscode-double-line-numbers.text.width.markdownDescription: Text width of left line numbers. Examples: `100`, `80%`. [More info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/textLength)

vscode-double-line-numbers.text.height.markdownDescription: Text height of left line numbers. Examples: `67`, `500%`. [More info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-size)

commands.title: Double Line Numbers: Toggle Line Highlighting

scripts.pretest: yarn run compile-tests && yarn run compile && yarn run lint
